list.name: Changes
list.comment:
refactor(build): Remove redundant `com.android.base` plugin
This commit removes the `com.android.base` plugin from the `app` module's `build.gradle.kts` file. This plugin was a temporary shim and is no longer needed.

project.component: { "keyToString": { "Android App.app.executor": "Run", "Batch.nuclear-clean.executor": "Run", "Gradle.Aurakai [classes].executor": "Run", "Gradle.Aurakai [clean].executor": "Run", "Gradle.Aurakai:app [assemble].executor": "Run", "Gradle.Configure Daemon JVM Criteria.executor": "Run", "Gradle.OptionalArtifactsPresence.docker artifacts exist when README mentions Docker.executor": "Run", "ModuleVcsDetector.initialDetectionPerformed": "true", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.TerminalTabsStorage.copyFrom.TerminalArrangementManager.252": "true", "RunOnceActivity.cidr.known.project.marker": "true", "RunOnceActivity.git.unshallow": "true", "RunOnceActivity.readMode.enableVisualFormatting": "true", "android.gradle.sync.needed": "true", "bazel.project.detector.is.bazel.project": "true", "cf.first.check.clang-format": "false", "cidr.known.project.marker": "true", "com.google.services.firebase.aqiPopupShown": "true", "git-widget-placeholder": "EXO", "kotlin-language-version-configured": "true", "project.structure.last.edited": "Suggestions", "project.structure.proportion": "0.17", "project.structure.side.proportion": "0.2", "run.code.analysis.last.selected.profile": "pProject Default", "settings.editor.selected.configurable": "reference.settingsdialog.project.gradle" } }

configuration.name: OptionalArtifactsPresence.docker artifacts exist when README mentions Docker

option.value: "MarkdownFileValidationTest$DocumentationLinks$OptionalArtifactsPresence.docker artifacts exist when README mentions Docker"

item.itemvalue: Gradle.OptionalArtifactsPresence.docker artifacts exist when README mentions Docker

task.summary: Default task

refactor: Remove explicit JVM toolchain from build-logic
The explicit `kotlin { jvmToolchain(23) }` block has been removed from `build-logic/settings.gradle.kts`. This change simplifies the configuration, as the JVM toolchain is managed by the parent project.

refactor: Adjust Hilt plugin and dependency configuration
Removes the explicit application of the `genesis.android.hilt` convention plugin from the `app` module.
The Hilt compiler dependency is changed from `ksp` to `implementation` to align with the new configuration.

refactor: Adjust Hilt plugin and dependency configuration
Removes the explicit application of the `genesis.android.hilt` convention plugin from the `app` module.
The Hilt compiler dependency is changed from `ksp` to `implementation` to align with the new configuration. refactor: Temporarily disable OpenAPI plugin tests and configure packaging
This commit addresses build issues by temporarily disabling the `OpenApiConventionPluginTest` suite due to unresolved plugin references. The entire test file has been commented out to allow the build to proceed.
Additionally, packaging options have been configured in the `app/build.gradle.kts` file to exclude `META-INF/INDEX.LIST` from the final artifact, resolving potential resource conflicts.Execution failed for task ':benchmark:mergeDebugAndroidTestJavaResource'. > A failure occurred while executing com.android.build.gradle.internal.tasks.MergeJavaResWorkAction > 6 files found with path 'META-INF/LICENSE.md' from inputs: - org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-params:5.12.2/jetified-junit-jupiter-params-5.12.2.jar - org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-engine:5.12.2/jetified-junit-jupiter-engine-5.12.2.jar - org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-api:5.12.2/jetified-junit-jupiter-api-5.12.2.jar - org.junit.platform:junit-platform-engine:1.12.2/jetified-junit-platform-engine-1.12.2.jar - org.junit.platform:junit-platform-commons:1.12.2/jetified-junit-platform-commons-1.12.2.jar - org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter:5.12.2/jetified-junit-jupiter-5.12.2.jar Adding a packaging block may help, please refer to https://developer.android.com/reference/tools/gradle-api/com/android/build/api/dsl/Packaging for more information * Try: > Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. > Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output. > Run with --scan to generate a Build Scan (Powered by Develocity). > Get more help at https://help.gradle.org. fix: Exclude LICENSE.md from packaging in multiple modules
This commit adds a packaging exclusion for `META-INF/LICENSE.md` to prevent duplicate file errors during the build process.
This change is applied to the `android` block in the `build.gradle.kts` files of the following modules: * `benchmark` * `feature-module` * `romtools` * `sandbox-ui`

refactor: Reorder build script blocks and add packaging exclusion
This commit refactors the `sandbox-ui/build.gradle.kts` file for better organization and adds a new packaging exclusion.
The `android`, `dependencies`, and `java` blocks have been reordered to follow a more conventional structure.
Additionally, `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` is now excluded from the packaging resources to prevent potential conflicts.

fix(build): Resolve packaging conflict for incremental annotation processors
In the `sandbox-ui` module, a `pickFirsts` strategy is added for the `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` file. This resolves a packaging conflict that occurs when multiple dependencies provide the same file, ensuring the build completes successfully.

refactor(build): Adjust packaging options in sandbox-ui
Removes the exclusion rules for `META-INF/LICENSE.md` and `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` from the `sandbox-ui` module's packaging options.
Instead of excluding the incremental annotation processor metadata, it is now configured to use `pickFirsts` to resolve potential duplicates.

refactor(build): Adjust packaging options in sandbox-ui
Removes the exclusion rules for `META-INF/LICENSE.md` and `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` from the `sandbox-ui` module's packaging options.
Instead of excluding the incremental annotation processor metadata, it is now configured to use `pickFirsts` to resolve potential duplicates.

build: Suppress deprecation warnings in Java compilation
This commit configures the Java compiler for the `app` module to suppress deprecation warnings by adding the `-Xlint:-deprecation` compiler argument.

build: Suppress deprecation warnings in Java compilation
This commit configures the Java compiler for the `app` module to suppress deprecation warnings by adding the `-Xlint:-deprecation` compiler argument.

build: Suppress deprecation warnings in Java compilation
This commit configures the Java compiler for the `app` module to suppress deprecation warnings by adding the `-Xlint:-deprecation` compiler argument.

refactor: Modernize code and clean up tests
This commit introduces two key changes: modernizing a deprecated path retrieval method in `RomToolsManager` and removing commented-out code from `MarkdownFileValidationTest`.
In `RomToolsManager.kt`, the deprecated `getPath()` method call on `Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory()` has been replaced with the modern `path` property accessor.
In `MarkdownFileValidationTest.kt`, several lines of commented-out code related to checking for Docker mentions have been removed to improve test clarity and maintainability.
refactor: Simplify regex patterns and remove unused tests in MarkdownFileValidationTest

feat: Update dependencies and streamline packaging
Updates the `kotlin-stdlib-jdk8` dependency from version `1.8.0` to `2.2.20` across the following modules: * `module-b` * `module-d` * `module-e` * `module-f`
In the `app` module, the packaging options are refined by adding an exclusion for `META-INF/INDEX.LIST` and removing a `JavaCompile` configuration that set the `-Xlint:-deprecation` compiler argument.
Additionally, the `logback-classic` runtime dependency is removed from the `data/api` module.

refactor: Remove unused KotlinCompile import in app module
Removes the unused `org.jetbrains.kotlin.gradle.tasks.KotlinCompile` import from the `app/build.gradle.kts` file, cleaning up the build script.

refactor: Remove unused KotlinCompile import in app module
Removes the unused `org.jetbrains.kotlin.gradle.tasks.KotlinCompile` import from the `app/build.gradle.kts` file, cleaning up the build script.

refactor: Consolidate Android application plugins and fix Hilt configuration
This commit refactors the build logic by moving common Android application plugins into the `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin`.
**Key Changes:** * The `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin` now automatically applies the following plugins: * `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` * `org.jetbrains.kotlin.plugin.compose` * `com.google.devtools.ksp` * `com.google.dagger.hilt.android` * In the `app` module's `build.gradle.kts`, the Hilt compiler dependency is correctly moved from the `implementation` configuration to `ksp` to align with modern best practices.

refactor: Enable AGP built-in Kotlin and simplify plugin application
This commit enables the Android Gradle Plugin's built-in Kotlin support by setting `android.builtInKotlin=true` in `gradle.properties`. The previous workaround that disabled this feature due to a Hilt incompatibility has been removed.
In `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin.kt`, the plugin application logic has been refactored to align with this change: * The explicit application of `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` is removed, as it's now handled by AGP's built-in support. * The `com.android.base` convention plugin is now applied. * The explicit configuration of the Kotlin JVM toolchain is removed, as it is now managed by the base convention plugin.

refactor: Downgrade toolchain to 24 and migrate data/api to version catalog
This commit downgrades the Java toolchain version from 25 to 24 in `gradle/gradle-daemon-jvm.properties`.
Additionally, the `data/api` module's build script (`build.gradle.kts`) has been updated to replace hardcoded dependency strings with type-safe accessors from the version catalog (`libs`). This affects the following dependencies: * Ktor (client-core, client-cio, client-content-negotiation) * Kotlinx (serialization-json, coroutines-core) * SLF4J * JUnit * Mockk

refactor: Downgrade toolchain to 24 and migrate data/api to version catalog
This commit downgrades the Java toolchain version from 25 to 24 in `gradle/gradle-daemon-jvm.properties`.
Additionally, the `data/api` module's build script (`build.gradle.kts`) has been updated to replace hardcoded dependency strings with type-safe accessors from the version catalog (`libs`). This affects the following dependencies: * Ktor (client-core, client-cio, client-content-negotiation) * Kotlinx (serialization-json, coroutines-core) * SLF4J * JUnit * Mockk

refactor: Standardize Hilt/KSP setup and revert AGP version
This commit refactors the build logic to standardize dependency configurations and reverts the Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) version.
**Key Changes:**
* **AGP Version:** The AGP version used in `build-logic` is reverted from `9.0.0-alpha09` back to `8.6.1`. * **Hilt/KSP Configuration:** * The Hilt compiler dependency configuration is updated from `ksp(libs.hilt.compiler)` to `add("ksp", libs.hilt.compiler)` across all modules. This change provides a more explicit and standardized way to apply the KSP processor. * In the `app` module, the Hilt compiler is now correctly an `implementation` dependency, not a `ksp` one. * **Build Logic Refinements:** * The `AndroidHiltConventionPlugin` is updated to apply the KSP plugin *after* the Hilt plugin, ensuring the correct processing order. * The `com.android.base` plugin, a workaround for AGP 9.0.0, has been removed from the `romtools` and `feature-module` modules. * The root `build.gradle.kts` no longer applies the `kotlin.android` plugin. * **Gradle Wrapper:** The `gradle-wrapper.properties` file has been cleaned up by removing redundant `distributionPath` and `networkTimeout` properties.

refactor: Change Hilt compiler from ksp to implementation
Updates the Hilt compiler dependency in the `app` module to use `implementation` instead of `ksp`. This aligns the configuration with standard practices for certain build setups.
A minor formatting change was also made by removing a blank line in the `plugins` block.

chore: Remove trailing newline from gradle.properties
This commit removes a trailing blank line from the `gradle.properties` file.

refactor(testing): Migrate benchmark ProGuard rules from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5
This commit updates the ProGuard rules for benchmarks to keep JUnit 5 annotations instead of JUnit 4.
The following annotation paths have been changed in `benchmark-rules.pro`: * `org.junit.Before` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach` * `org.junit.After` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach` * `org.junit.Test` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`

refactor(testing): Migrate benchmark ProGuard rules from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5
This commit updates the ProGuard rules for benchmarks to keep JUnit 5 annotations instead of JUnit 4.
The following annotation paths have been changed in `benchmark-rules.pro`: * `org.junit.Before` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach` * `org.junit.After` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach` * `org.junit.Test` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`

build: Remove `android.builtInKotlin=true` from gradle.properties
This commit removes the `android.builtInKotlin=true` flag from the `gradle.properties` file. This property, used for AGP 9.0+ compatibility, is no longer needed.

fix(build): Apply AGP 9.0 Hilt workaround and configure toolchain
This commit introduces several build configuration changes to ensure compatibility with Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) 9.0 and stabilize the build environment.
The key changes include: * **AGP 9.0 Hilt Workaround**: The `com.android.base` plugin is now applied to the `sandbox-ui`, `benchmark`, `romtools`, and `feature-module` library modules. This is a necessary workaround for Hilt's annotation processor to correctly identify Android library modules in AGP 9.0. * **JVM Toolchain**: The JVM toolchain is explicitly set to version 24 in the `data/api` module to ensure consistent Java versioning across the project. * **Built-in Kotlin Opt-out**: The `android.builtInKotlin` flag has been set to `false` in `gradle.properties` as a temporary measure to avoid potential migration issues with other plugins.

fix(hilt): Resolve ClassNotFoundException crash
This commit resolves a `ClassNotFoundException` crash on launch caused by conflicting `@HiltAndroidApp` annotations.
The root cause was multiple `Application` classes being annotated with `@HiltAndroidApp`, which prevented Hilt's annotation processor from generating the necessary Dagger components.
Key changes: * **Removed duplicate `@HiltAndroidApp` annotation** from `AuraKaiHiltApplication` to ensure only the primary `ReGenesisApplication` (declared in the manifest) is annotated. * **Added `com.android.base` plugin** to the `app` module and `AndroidHiltConventionPlugin` to serve as a shim for Hilt compatibility with AGP 9. * Added two new files, `FIX_SUMMARY.md` and `fix-hilt-crash.ps1`, to document the problem, the applied fixes, and provide a script for automating the recovery process.

feat(build-logic): Add com.android.base plugin for AGP 9
This commit applies the `com.android.base` plugin in the `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin`.
This change is necessary to expose the `BaseExtension` for Hilt when using Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) version 9 alpha.

feat(build-logic): Add com.android.base plugin for AGP 9
This commit applies the `com.android.base` plugin in the `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin`.
This change is necessary to expose the `BaseExtension` for Hilt when using Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) version 9 alpha.

refactor(build): Remove redundant `com.android.base` plugin
This commit removes the `com.android.base` plugin from the `app` module's `build.gradle.kts` file. This plugin was a temporary shim and is no longer needed.

MESSAGE.value:
refactor(build): Streamline packaging configuration in sandbox-ui
Removes unnecessary resource exclusion rules for `META-INF/LICENSE.md` and `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` from the `sandbox-ui` module's `build.gradle.kts`.
The `pickFirsts` strategy for `incremental.annotation.processors` already handles potential conflicts, making the exclusion redundant.

refactor(build): Streamline packaging configuration in sandbox-ui
Removes unnecessary resource exclusion rules for `META-INF/LICENSE.md` and `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` from the `sandbox-ui` module's `build.gradle.kts`.
The `pickFirsts` strategy for `incremental.annotation.processors` already handles potential conflicts, making the exclusion redundant.2 files found with path 'META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors' from inputs: - com.google.dagger:hilt-compiler:2.57.2/jetified-hilt-compiler-2.57.2.jar - com.google.dagger:dagger-compiler:2.57.2/jetified-dagger-compiler-2.57.2.jar Adding a packaging block may help, please refer to https://developer.android.com/reference/tools/gradle-api/com/android/build/api/dsl/Packaging for more information

refactor: Streamline packaging options in sandbox-ui
Removes unnecessary exclusion rules for `META-INF/LICENSE.md` and `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` from the `packaging` block in `sandbox-ui/build.gradle.kts`. The `pickFirsts` directive for the incremental annotation processors remains.

refactor(build): Adjust packaging options in sandbox-ui
Removes the exclusion rules for `META-INF/LICENSE.md` and `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` from the `sandbox-ui` module's packaging options.
Instead of excluding the incremental annotation processor metadata, it is now configured to use `pickFirsts` to resolve potential duplicates.

refactor(deps): Migrate romtools dependencies and handle packaging conflicts
Migrates two dependencies in the `romtools` module to use the version catalog (`libs`): * `androidx.compose.material:material-icons-extended` is now `libs.androidx.material.icons.extended`. * `androidx.hilt:hilt-navigation-compose` is now `libs.hilt.navigation.compose`.
A `packaging` block has been added to `romtools/build.gradle.kts` to resolve a build conflict by excluding and then picking first the `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` resource.
Finally, the `androidx.compose.material:material-icons-extended` dependency has been added to `gradle/libs.versions.toml` under the alias `androidx-material-icons-extended`.

refactor(deps): Migrate romtools dependencies and add packaging rules
This commit refactors the `romtools` module to improve dependency management and resolve packaging conflicts.
Key changes include: * The dependencies for `material-icons-extended` and `hilt-navigation-compose` are now sourced from the version catalog for better consistency. * A new packaging rule has been added to exclude and then pick the first instance of `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` to prevent build failures from duplicate files.
Additionally, the `androidx-material-icons-extended` alias has been added to the `libs.versions.toml` file.

refactor: Update dependencies and packaging options
This commit updates dependencies to use the version catalog and adjusts packaging options to exclude Gradle annotation processor metadata.
**Dependency Management:** * The `androidx.compose.material:material-icons-extended` and `androidx.hilt:hilt-navigation-compose` dependencies in the `romtools` module are updated to use their respective aliases from the version catalog (`libs`). * A new alias, `androidx-material-icons-extended`, is added to `gradle/libs.versions.toml` for `androidx.compose.material:material-icons-extended`.
**Packaging Options:** * The `packaging.resources.excludes` block in the `app` and `romtools` modules is updated to exclude `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors`.

refactor: Update dependencies and packaging options
This commit updates dependencies to use the version catalog and adds a packaging exclusion to resolve build conflicts.
**Dependency Management:** * In the `romtools` module, the dependencies for `material-icons-extended` and `hilt-navigation-compose` have been updated to use their respective aliases from the `libs.versions.toml` version catalog. * A new alias, `androidx-material-icons-extended`, has been added to `libs.versions.toml` for `androidx.compose.material:material-icons-extended`.
**Build Configuration:** * A packaging exclusion for `META-INF/gradle/incremental.annotation.processors` has been added to the `app` and `romtools` modules to prevent resource conflicts.

build: Suppress deprecation warnings in Java compilation
This commit configures the Java compiler for the `app` module to suppress deprecation warnings by adding the `-Xlint:-deprecation` compiler argument.

refactor: Modernize code and clean up tests
This commit introduces two key changes: modernizing a deprecated path retrieval method in `RomToolsManager` and removing commented-out code from `MarkdownFileValidationTest`.
In `RomToolsManager.kt`, the deprecated `getPath()` method call on `Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory()` has been replaced with the modern `path` property accessor.
In `MarkdownFileValidationTest.kt`, several lines of commented-out code related to checking for Docker mentions have been removed to improve test clarity and maintainability.
refactor: Simplify regex patterns and remove unused tests in MarkdownFileValidationTest

feat: Update dependencies and streamline packaging
Updates the `kotlin-stdlib-jdk8` dependency from version `1.8.0` to `2.2.20` across the following modules: * `module-b` * `module-d` * `module-e` * `module-f`
In the `app` module, the packaging options are refined by adding an exclusion for `META-INF/INDEX.LIST` and removing a `JavaCompile` configuration that set the `-Xlint:-deprecation` compiler argument.
Additionally, the `logback-classic` runtime dependency is removed from the `data/api` module.

refactor: Remove unused KotlinCompile import in app module
Removes the unused `org.jetbrains.kotlin.gradle.tasks.KotlinCompile` import from the `app/build.gradle.kts` file, cleaning up the build script.

refactor: Consolidate Android application plugins and fix Hilt configuration
This commit refactors the build logic by moving common Android application plugins into the `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin`.
**Key Changes:** * The `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin` now automatically applies the following plugins: * `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` * `org.jetbrains.kotlin.plugin.compose` * `com.google.devtools.ksp` * `com.google.dagger.hilt.android` * In the `app` module's `build.gradle.kts`, the Hilt compiler dependency is correctly moved from the `implementation` configuration to `ksp` to align with modern best practices.

refactor: Enable AGP built-in Kotlin and simplify plugin application
This commit enables the Android Gradle Plugin's built-in Kotlin support by setting `android.builtInKotlin=true` in `gradle.properties`. The previous workaround that disabled this feature due to a Hilt incompatibility has been removed.
In `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin.kt`, the plugin application logic has been refactored to align with this change: * The explicit application of `org.jetbrains.kotlin.android` is removed, as it's now handled by AGP's built-in support. * The `com.android.base` convention plugin is now applied. * The explicit configuration of the Kotlin JVM toolchain is removed, as it is now managed by the base convention plugin.

refactor: Downgrade toolchain to 24 and migrate data/api to version catalog
This commit downgrades the Java toolchain version from 25 to 24 in `gradle/gradle-daemon-jvm.properties`.
Additionally, the `data/api` module's build script (`build.gradle.kts`) has been updated to replace hardcoded dependency strings with type-safe accessors from the version catalog (`libs`). This affects the following dependencies: * Ktor (client-core, client-cio, client-content-negotiation) * Kotlinx (serialization-json, coroutines-core) * SLF4J * JUnit * Mockk

refactor: Standardize Hilt/KSP setup and revert AGP version
This commit refactors the build logic to standardize dependency configurations and reverts the Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) version.
**Key Changes:**
* **AGP Version:** The AGP version used in `build-logic` is reverted from `9.0.0-alpha09` back to `8.6.1`. * **Hilt/KSP Configuration:** * The Hilt compiler dependency configuration is updated from `ksp(libs.hilt.compiler)` to `add("ksp", libs.hilt.compiler)` across all modules. This change provides a more explicit and standardized way to apply the KSP processor. * In the `app` module, the Hilt compiler is now correctly an `implementation` dependency, not a `ksp` one. * **Build Logic Refinements:** * The `AndroidHiltConventionPlugin` is updated to apply the KSP plugin *after* the Hilt plugin, ensuring the correct processing order. * The `com.android.base` plugin, a workaround for AGP 9.0.0, has been removed from the `romtools` and `feature-module` modules. * The root `build.gradle.kts` no longer applies the `kotlin.android` plugin. * **Gradle Wrapper:** The `gradle-wrapper.properties` file has been cleaned up by removing redundant `distributionPath` and `networkTimeout` properties.

**Key Changes:**
* **AGP Version:** The AGP version used in `build-logic` is reverted from `9.0.0-alpha09` back to `8.6.1`. * **Hilt/KSP Configuration:** * The Hilt compiler dependency configuration is updated from `ksp(libs.hilt.compiler)` to `add("ksp", libs.hilt.compiler)` across all modules. refactor: Change Hilt compiler from ksp to implementation
Updates the Hilt compiler dependency in the `app` module to use `implementation` instead of `ksp`. This aligns the configuration with standard practices for certain build setups.
A minor formatting change was also made by removing a blank line in the `plugins` block.

refactor(testing): Migrate benchmark ProGuard rules from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5
This commit updates the ProGuard rules for benchmarks to keep JUnit 5 annotations instead of JUnit 4.
The following annotation paths have been changed in `benchmark-rules.pro`: * `org.junit.Before` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach` * `org.junit.After` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach` * `org.junit.Test` is now `org.junit.jupiter.api.Test`

build: Remove `android.builtInKotlin=true` from gradle.properties
This commit removes the `android.builtInKotlin=true` flag from the `gradle.properties` file. This property, used for AGP 9.0+ compatibility, is no longer needed.

fix(build): Apply AGP 9.0 Hilt workaround and configure toolchain
This commit introduces several build configuration changes to ensure compatibility with Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) 9.0 and stabilize the build environment.
The key changes include: * **AGP 9.0 Hilt Workaround**: The `com.android.base` plugin is now applied to the `sandbox-ui`, `benchmark`, `romtools`, and `feature-module` library modules. This is a necessary workaround for Hilt's annotation processor to correctly identify Android library modules in AGP 9.0. * **JVM Toolchain**: The JVM toolchain is explicitly set to version 24 in the `data/api` module to ensure consistent Java versioning across the project. * **Built-in Kotlin Opt-out**: The `android.builtInKotlin` flag has been set to `false` in `gradle.properties` as a temporary measure to avoid potential migration issues with other plugins.

fix(hilt): Resolve ClassNotFoundException crash
This commit resolves a `ClassNotFoundException` crash on launch caused by conflicting `@HiltAndroidApp` annotations.
The root cause was multiple `Application` classes being annotated with `@HiltAndroidApp`, which prevented Hilt's annotation processor from generating the necessary Dagger components.
Key changes: * **Removed duplicate `@HiltAndroidApp` annotation** from `AuraKaiHiltApplication` to ensure only the primary `ReGenesisApplication` (declared in the manifest) is annotated. * **Added `com.android.base` plugin** to the `app` module and `AndroidHiltConventionPlugin` to serve as a shim for Hilt compatibility with AGP 9. * Added two new files, `FIX_SUMMARY.md` and `fix-hilt-crash.ps1`, to document the problem, the applied fixes, and provide a script for automating the recovery process.

feat(build-logic): Add com.android.base plugin for AGP 9
This commit applies the `com.android.base` plugin in the `AndroidApplicationConventionPlugin`.
This change is necessary to expose the `BaseExtension` for Hilt when using Android Gradle Plugin (AGP) version 9 alpha.

refactor(build): Remove redundant `com.android.base` plugin
This commit removes the `com.android.base` plugin from the `app` module's `build.gradle.kts` file. This plugin was a temporary shim and is no longer needed.
